bibl.title: Letter from J.L. Ahrendts to [Philip Showalter Hench], May 22, 1942

div1.p: Ahrendts informs [Hench] that Pinto claims to have been the first person inoculated by Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from J.L. Ahrendts to [Philip Showalter Hench], May 22, 1942
div1.opener:
C O P Y
JOHN WYETH & BROTHER
Incorporated
PHILADELPHIA, PA
May 22, 1942.
J. L. Ahrendts
Representative
4728 North 39 Street
Omaha, Nebraska
Dear Doctor French,
div1.p:
Just a little word of history for you
in connection with “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”. Dr.
Sherman S. Pinto of this city was in the group shown
on the painting. He says that he was inoculated by
Dr. Lazear as the first test and that following him
was the inoculation of Dr. Carroll, as shown in the
picture. Dr. Pinto named every character and made
much comment on the setting that is not shown or re-
lated in the picture or descriptive booklet.

Of course it make me sore that one
of my fine doctors who played such an important part
is not in the painting. I was told by a member in
his office that to date they have been able to get
very little information from him.
